text.p: Following are the main stories in Croatian newspapers on Tuesday.
- All could be prepared for the Croatian Danube region elections if they were to be held on December 15, said at yestereday's government press conference, deputy Prime Minister Ivica Kostovic.
- The goal of Croatian Radio-Television (HRT) is the strengthening of pluralism and democracy, said its director Ivica Mudrinic during HRT's Council session.
- The average net salaries in Croatia in August up by 3.9 percent compared to July and now stand at 2,071 kuna.
- Funerals: It is more expensive to die than to live in Croatia, as a nice funeral coupled with a burial place cost the same as a one-room apartment.
- More airplanes needed if Croatian Airlines is to meet the needs of tourism.
- Croatian government regular press conference: A law to be passed against money laundering.
- Pensions being received by Croatian citizens from the occupied sections of the country: The state is not trying to "bribe" the Serbs with pensions.
- I already have enough work for the next three years, claims the newly appointed chief prosecutor of the Hague tribunal, Louise Arbour. -- Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
